page.title: 16CHALFONT AREA FARMING
page.content: Farming in the area is particularly varied, with quite a heavy emphasis placed on crop growing. This is probably due to the influence of the E.E.C.. In addition to crop growing farms there are also a few small holdings, which have either a few cows or sheep. Horseriding is particularly popular locally and this is also reflected in the farms. Of the seven farms visited four were mainly stud farms. Stone Dean farm houses about thirty horses. It was built in 1891 and the owners of this farm, as well as those of other farms, rent a considerable proportion of the total average. They own thirty-two acres and rent three times this amount, for riding and grazing purposes. Stampwell Farm was one of the biggest visted. The owners did not rent any land, all the 275 acres are their own property.
